body:
It certainly looks promising. But does it solve the "file:///URL" problem?

Because it can open up to quite a lot of nasty things, so much that Fetch Spec decides to leave it out of the spec. Which is also why we opt to leave it alone in #75 .

For now I am quite fine with default `url` parser. Did you run into any problems?

ref: https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#basic-fetch

I'm not aware of the local file problem. Please tell me.

Aside from that, however, core `url.parse` will still parse such URLs, so I don't see a difference there.

I have not run into any blocking issues as a result of this, but here's a URL that `url.parse` currently does not support:
- http://-.~_!$&'()*+,;=:%40:80%2f::::::@example.com

issue.title: Incompatible API in url encode

repository.name: node-fetch
repository.description: A light-weight module that brings the Fetch API to Node.js

body: The support for this could be pretty easily added. The spec for the [Request class](https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#request-class) states that the first argument to `new Request()` must be either another `Request` or a `USVString`; WHATWG's URL class when coerced to a string returns the URL in string format -- the coercion we should already be doing.

issue.title: Support WHATWG URL objects

repository.name: node-fetch
repository.description: A light-weight module that brings the Fetch API to Node.js

issue.body: Fixes #175. As a side effect, after this PR `new Request(null)` will not throw anymore, and therefore more conforming to the spec.

issue.title: Work in progress: node-fetch v2

repository.name: node-fetch
repository.description: A light-weight module that brings the Fetch API to Node.js

issue.body:
## DO NOT MERGE

This PR will be continuously updated as more updates roll in. Feel free to initiate pull requests against this branch to help with this process.
## Work needed to be done
- [x] Use Babel
- [x] Add iterator interface to Headers #174
- [x] Convert all files to modern JavaScript syntax
- Split and merge #140 
  - ~~WHATWG streams support~~
  - [x] Text encoding conversion #184 #188
  - [ ] Determine behavior of `.blob()` 
- [x] Resolve Headers incompatibility #181 #185
- [ ] Implement a few missing methods such as `Response.error` and `Response.redirect`
- [x] Fix spec compliance for objects as URL #175 #187
## Discussion
- **Code style:** it seems to be preferred that spaces are used instead of tabs for most people (myself included), so should we use that instead? **No.**

issue.title: Feature request: Support URL object as fetch argument
